title: N03-1026

sentences.text: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation .

Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection .
Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems .
An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings .
Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

Entity-proposed_system.label: proposed system
Entity-proposed_system.description: The proposed system is a state-of-the-art sentence condensation software that utilizes ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques within a Lexical-Functional Grammar framework, ensuring grammaticality in its output through a constraint-based parser/generator.

Entity-ambiguity_packing_and_stochastic_.label: ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques
aliases: ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques
Entity-ambiguity_packing_and_stochastic_.description: Ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques refer to methods used in the context of Lexical-Functional Grammars for optimizing sentence condensation by managing multiple interpretations of sentences and selecting the most probable outputs through probabilistic models.

mentions.local_name: ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques

Entity-ambiguity_packing.label: ambiguity packing
Entity-ambiguity_packing.description: Ambiguity packing is a linguistic method used in conjunction with stochastic disambiguation techniques to enhance the processing of Lexical-Functional Grammars (LFG) for applications such as sentence condensation.

Entity-stochastic_disambiguation.label: stochastic disambiguation
Entity-stochastic_disambiguation.description: Stochastic disambiguation refers to a method used in the context of Lexical-Functional Grammars (LFG) that employs probabilistic techniques to resolve ambiguities in linguistic structures, particularly in applications such as sentence condensation.

Entity-our_system.label: Our system
Entity-our_system.description: Our system refers to a sophisticated sentence condensation framework that utilizes a linguistic parser/generator based on Lexical-Functional Grammar, a transfer component for reducing parse trees, and a maximum-entropy model for selecting stochastic outputs.

Entity-lfg.label: LFG
Entity-lfg.description: LFG refers to Lexical-Functional Grammar, a linguistic framework used for parsing and generating sentences, particularly in the context of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques.

Entity-sentence_condensation_system.label: sentence condensation systems
Entity-sentence_condensation_system.description: Sentence condensation systems are advanced text processing tools that utilize linguistic parsing and stochastic techniques to automatically summarize and condense sentences while ensuring grammaticality and high-quality output.

Entity-stochastic_disambiguation_techniq.label: stochastic disambiguation techniques
Entity-stochastic_disambiguation_techniq.description: Stochastic disambiguation techniques refer to methods that utilize probabilistic models, such as maximum-entropy models, to resolve ambiguities in linguistic structures, specifically applied here to enhance the performance of Lexical-Functional Grammars in the context of sentence condensation.

Entity-stochastic_output_selection.label: stochastic output selection
Entity-stochastic_output_selection.description: Stochastic output selection refers to a maximum-entropy model used in the context of a linguistic parser/generator for Lexical-Functional Grammars, which probabilistically determines the most appropriate outputs during the process of sentence condensation.

Entity-sentence_condensation.label: sentence condensation
Entity-sentence_condensation.description: Sentence condensation refers to a text summarization technique that reduces the length of sentences while preserving their essential meaning, often utilizing linguistic parsing and stochastic models to enhance the quality and grammaticality of the output.

Entity-automatic_parse-based_evaluation.label: automatic parse-based evaluation
Entity-automatic_parse-based_evaluation.description: Automatic parse-based evaluation refers to a method for assessing the quality of sentence condensation systems by using standard parser evaluation techniques to automatically compare the generated outputs against manual evaluations.

Entity-generated_string.label: generated strings
Entity-generated_string.description: The term 'generated strings' refers to the outputs produced by the sentence condensation system, which are evaluated for summarization quality in relation to both automatic and manual assessments.

Entity-the_system_output.label: the system output
Entity-the_system_output.description: The system output refers to the generated strings produced by the proposed sentence condensation system, which are ensured to be grammatically correct through the use of a constraint-based parser/generator.

Entity-overall_summarization_quality.label: Overall summarization quality
Entity-overall_summarization_quality.description: Overall summarization quality refers to the effectiveness and grammatical correctness of the output generated by a sentence condensation system, evaluated through both automatic and manual methods, indicating its performance relative to state-of-the-art standards.

Entity-standard_parser_evaluation_method.label: standard parser evaluation methods
Entity-standard_parser_evaluation_method.description: Standard parser evaluation methods refer to established techniques used to assess the performance and accuracy of linguistic parsers, particularly in the context of evaluating the quality of generated outputs in natural language processing tasks such as sentence condensation.

Entity-parse_reduction.label: parse reduction
Entity-parse_reduction.description: Parse reduction refers to a transfer component in a linguistic system that operates on packed parse forests to simplify or condense the structure of sentences within the context of Lexical-Functional Grammars.

Entity-constraint-based_parsergenerator.label: constraint-based parser/generator
Entity-constraint-based_parsergenerator.description: A constraint-based parser/generator is a natural language processing tool that utilizes a set of linguistic constraints to analyze and produce grammatically correct sentences.

Entity-transfer_component.label: transfer component
Entity-transfer_component.description: The transfer component refers to a software module within the system that performs parse reduction on packed parse forests to facilitate sentence condensation in the context of Lexical-Functional Grammars.

Entity-manual_evaluation_of_generated_st.label: manual evaluation of generated strings
Entity-manual_evaluation_of_generated_st.description: The manual evaluation of generated strings refers to the process of human assessment of the quality and coherence of text outputs produced by a system, particularly in the context of summarization and sentence condensation, to ensure that the generated content meets linguistic and contextual standards.

Entity-linguistic_parsergenerator.label: linguistic parser/generator
Entity-linguistic_parsergenerator.description: A linguistic parser/generator is a software tool designed to analyze and produce natural language text by processing linguistic structures and generating syntactically and semantically correct sentences.

Entity-packed_parse_forest.label: packed parse forests
Entity-packed_parse_forest.description: Packed parse forests are a data structure used in computational linguistics to represent multiple parse trees for a given input in a compact form, allowing for efficient storage and processing of syntactic information.

Entity-parser_evaluation_method.label: parser evaluation methods
Entity-parser_evaluation_method.description: Parser evaluation methods are systematic approaches used to assess the performance and accuracy of parsing algorithms in natural language processing.

Entity-lexical-functional_grammar.label: Lexical-Functional Grammars
Entity-lexical-functional_grammar.description: Lexical-Functional Grammars is a theoretical framework in linguistics that focuses on the relationship between the syntactic structure of sentences and their functional aspects, emphasizing the role of both syntax and semantics in language analysis.

Entity-guaranteed_grammaticality.label: guaranteed grammaticality
Entity-guaranteed_grammaticality.description: Guaranteed grammaticality refers to the assurance that the output generated by a linguistic system, specifically a constraint-based parser/generator, adheres to the rules of grammar, ensuring that the sentences produced are grammatically correct.

Entity-summarization_quality.label: summarization quality
Entity-summarization_quality.description: Summarization quality refers to the measure or evaluation of how effectively a summarization system condenses information while maintaining its essential meaning and coherence.

Entity-experimental_evaluation_of_summar.label: experimental evaluation of summarization quality
aliases: An experimental evaluation of summarization quality
Entity-experimental_evaluation_of_summar.description: A systematic assessment method that measures the effectiveness and accuracy of summarization techniques through controlled experiments.

mentions.local_name: An experimental evaluation of summarization quality

Entity-maximum-entropy_model.label: maximum-entropy model
Entity-maximum-entropy_model.description: The maximum-entropy model is a statistical model used in machine learning that predicts outcomes based on the principle of maximizing entropy subject to given constraints, often applied in various fields such as natural language processing and information theory.

Entity-grammaticality_of_the_system_outp.label: grammaticality of the system output
Entity-grammaticality_of_the_system_outp.description: the degree to which the output generated by a system adheres to the rules and conventions of a given language.

Entity-grammaticality.label: grammaticality
Entity-grammaticality.description: Grammaticality refers to the property of a sentence or phrase being in accordance with the rules and conventions of a given language, indicating whether it is structurally correct and acceptable within that language.

Entity-experimental_evaluation.label: experimental evaluation
Entity-experimental_evaluation.description: Experimental evaluation refers to a systematic method of assessing the effectiveness or quality of a process, product, or system through controlled experiments and empirical data collection.

Entity-manual_evaluation.label: manual evaluation
Entity-manual_evaluation.description: Manual evaluation refers to the process of assessing the quality or performance of a task or output through human judgment and analysis, rather than relying solely on automated methods.

Entity-system_output.label: system output
Entity-system_output.description: The term 'system output' refers to the results or data produced by a computational system or algorithm, typically as a response to input or processing tasks.

Entity-state-of-the-art.label: state-of-the-art
Entity-state-of-the-art.description: state-of-the-art refers to the highest level of development or performance achieved in a particular field, often characterized by the latest advancements and superior quality.

summary: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation . Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection . Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems . An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings . Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

Predicate-applies_to.label: applies to
Predicate-applies_to.description: The predicate 'applies to' indicates a relationship where the subject is relevant or pertinent to the object, suggesting that the subject can be utilized, implemented, or is suitable for the context or framework represented by the object. This connection implies that the subject has a functional or theoretical association with the object, often in a way that enhances understanding, application, or analysis within the domain defined by the object.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' indicates that the subject includes or integrates the object as a part of its structure or functionality. It suggests a relationship where the subject actively combines or utilizes the object to enhance its capabilities or to fulfill a specific purpose.

Predicate-operates_on.label: operates on
Predicate-operates_on.description: The predicate 'operates on' indicates a functional relationship where the subject performs actions, processes, or manipulations that directly affect or utilize the object. It suggests that the subject is actively engaging with the object in a manner that alters, analyzes, or interacts with it, thereby establishing a dynamic connection between the two entities.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' indicates a purpose, function, or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject serves or is designed to achieve the outcome or goal represented by the object.

Predicate-is_used_for.label: is used for
Predicate-is_used_for.description: The predicate 'is used for' indicates a functional relationship where the subject serves a specific purpose or application represented by the object. It implies that the subject is employed or utilized in a manner that facilitates, supports, or enables the action or outcome described by the object.

Predicate-propose_the_use_of.label: propose the use of
Predicate-propose_the_use_of.description: The predicate 'propose the use of' indicates a suggestion or recommendation made by the subject regarding the implementation or application of the object. It connects the subject, which typically represents an idea, method, or framework, to the object, which is the specific practice, tool, or concept being recommended for use. This predicate implies an advocacy for the adoption of the object in a relevant context.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: The predicate 'evaluate' signifies the action of assessing or determining the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the object in relation to the subject. In this context, the subject represents a method, technique, or framework that is being used to analyze or measure the characteristics of the object, which is typically a specific aspect, outcome, or performance metric. The evaluation process involves comparing the object against established criteria or standards to derive conclusions about its value or success.

Predicate-correlates_with.label: correlates with
Predicate-correlates_with.description: The predicate 'correlates with' indicates a relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that there is a statistical or conceptual association between the two entities. This relationship implies that changes or variations in the subject are related to changes or variations in the object, often indicating a degree of dependency or similarity in their characteristics or outcomes.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the characteristics or qualities described by the object, effectively asserting that the subject can be defined or classified in terms of the object. This relationship often conveys a state of being, classification, or a specific attribute that the subject embodies.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a relationship of possession or attribute between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the object. In this context, it implies that the subject exhibits a certain quality or feature represented by the object.

Predicate-is_due_to_the_use_of.label: is due to the use of
Predicate-is_due_to_the_use_of.description: The predicate 'is due to the use of' establishes a causal relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject's state, condition, or outcome is a result of employing the object. It implies that the effectiveness, functionality, or characteristics of the subject can be attributed to the application or implementation of the object in question.

Predicate-is_ensured_by.label: is ensured by
Predicate-is_ensured_by.description: The predicate 'is ensured by' establishes a relationship where the subject is guaranteed or made certain by the object. It indicates that the object plays a crucial role in providing assurance, support, or validation to the subject, thereby contributing to its reliability or correctness.

Predicate-ensures.label: ensures
Predicate-ensures.description: The predicate 'ensures' indicates a relationship where the subject is responsible for guaranteeing or securing a certain condition or quality represented by the object. In this context, it implies that the subject actively contributes to the fulfillment or maintenance of the state described by the object, thereby establishing a sense of reliability or assurance regarding that state.

Predicate-utilizes.label: utilizes
Predicate-utilizes.description: The predicate 'utilizes' indicates that the subject employs or makes use of the object in order to achieve a specific purpose or function. It suggests an active engagement where the subject leverages the capabilities or features of the object to enhance its performance, effectiveness, or efficiency in a given context.

Predicate-is_used_in_conjunction_with.label: is used in conjunction with
Predicate-is_used_in_conjunction_with.description: The predicate 'is used in conjunction with' indicates a relationship where the subject and object are employed together or in combination to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. This suggests that both elements complement each other and are often utilized simultaneously in a particular context or process.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset of the more general concept represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of meanings or applications than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader category.
